content: lines repeats every 18 row see red boxes the cables in between occur every 5 row this is one of the nods to the traditional fisherman sweaters a lot of the designs ask for a cable every 5 rounds if you keep track of your work in a notebook like i do you may find that cable-ing every 5th row is easier than in multiples of 4 or 6 work so your last row worked is the row before a cable row for the next row work the sts on needle 1 as per the chart on needle 2 work as per the chart but instead of the cables work a cable decrease each as follows slip 2 sts onto a cable needle hold that needle in front of your work and knit 1 st from the cable needle together with 1 st from your left needle repeat this will decrease 2 sts per cable so at the end of this round you will have 36 sts on needle 1 and 32 sts on needle 2 heel the heel will be worked over the sts on needle 2 so turn and work row 1 of the heel as a ws row row 1 sl1 purlwise p to end turn row 2 sl1 purlwise k1 to end turn row 3 sl1 purlwise p to end turn row 4 sl1 purlwise sl1 purlwise k1 to last st k1 turn repeat these 4 row until the heel flap is as long as desired work a multiple of 4 row i have worked 40 for my sample socks work row 1 one more time boddam page 3 turn the heel as follows row1 sl1 purlwise k1 8 times k1 ssk k1 turn 12 sts unworked row2 sl1 p3 p2tog p1 turn again 12 sts unworked row3 sl1 k to 1 st before the gap ssk k1 turn row4 sl1 p to 1 st before the gap p2tog p1 turn repeat the last 2 row until you have used up all the sts on your needles ending with a row 4 and 18 sts on your needle k9 this is the centre back of your sock and the new beginning of your rounds gusset the gusset is the second major reference to traditional fisherman sweaters being rather close fitting these sweaters traditionally incorporate an under arm gusset to facilitate movement the gusset on these socks are shaped to resemble this so they are worked a bit different to a normal sock with needle 1 k9 pick up and k 1 st in each of the slipped stitches all the way down the heel flap to the instep you should pick up half the number of sts that you have knitted row in your flap i e 20 sts for a 40 row flap m1
